Wisdom: مَا أَقْبَحَ بِالْإِنْسَانِ ظَاهِراً مُوَافِقاً وَبَاطِناً مُنَافِقاً
enWisdom: How repulsive is it for a human being to agree externally while being hypocritical internally

Wisdom: مَا أَقْبَحَ بِالْإِنْسَانِ بَاطِناً عَلِيلًا وَظَاهِراً جَمِيلًا
enWisdom: How reprehensible it is for a human being to have a sick interior and a beautiful exterior

Wisdom: مَا أَقْبَحَ بِالْإِنْسَانِ أَنْ يَكُونَ ذَا وَجْهَيْنِ
enWisdom: How repulsive it is for a human being to be two-faced

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالنِّفَاقَ فَإِنَّ ذَا الْوَجْهَيْنِ لَا يَكُونُ وَجِيهاً عِنْدَ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: Beware of hypocrisy, for indeed the two-faced person is not eminent in the sight of Allah

Wisdom: مَثَلُ الْمُنَافِقِ كَالْحَنْظَلَةِ الْخَضِرَةِ أَوْرَاقُهَا الْمُرِّ مَذَاقُهَا
enWisdom: The example of the hypocrite is that of a colocynth, its leaves are green but its taste is bitter

Wisdom: قَالَ ع فِي وَصْفِ الْمُنَافِقِينَ هُمْ لُمَّةُ الشَّيْطَانِ وَحُمَّةُ النِّيرَانِ أُولئِكَ حِزْبُ الشَّيْطانِ أَلا إِنَّ حِزْبَ الشَّيْطانِ هُمُ الْخاسِرُونَ
enWisdom: He (‘a) described the hypocrites thus: they are jealous of [those in] comfort, intensify [the] distress [of the distressed] and destroy hopes [of the hopeful]Their fallen victims are lying on every path, they have means to approach every heart and they have false tears for every [occasion of] grief
Hypocrisy is the twin of disbelief

Wisdom: نِفَاقُ الْمَرْءِ مِنْ ذُلٍّ يَجِدُهُ فِي نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: The hypocrisy of a person stems from the inferiority [and humiliation] he finds within himself
Hypocrisy is from the andirons of ignominy
